intro: Cynorkis angustipetala var. oxypetala, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oxypetal cynorkis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive spurred lip. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
